alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 3:02PM EDT until March 26 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches through Saturday evening, with additional snow accumulations likely Saturday night into Sunday morning. The higher accumulations will be on western facing slopes. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Additionally, there may be snow squalls Saturday during the day with brief intense snow rates and low visibilities. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
